security: Disclosing details about AMMUG-1's housing and operational expenses could compromise the security and confidentiality of the operation. For example, revealing that "BUYING linens for the apartment out of ops expenses" exposes financial practices and could lead to identifying AMMUG-1 and their location.
summary: A memo detailing actions related to securing an INS card for AMMUG-1 and preparing a safe apartment at Summit Hill for AMMUG-1 to move into on July 1st, including purchasing linens out of operational expenses.
summary_one_paragraph: This memo, dated June 30, 1964, outlines efforts to obtain an INS card for AMMUG-1 by contacting Mr. Knott in the Alien Affairs Staff, and preparations for AMMUG-1 to move into a safe apartment at Summit Hill on July 1st. The memo mentions checking the apartment's readiness, picking up the lease from a lawyer, and Lou DeSanti and Danjel Flores assisting with the move. It also notes the purchase of linens for the apartment using operational expenses, and includes a note about making a check for rendering July rent.
title: IN &S CARD
